teach2000.model.users

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • teach2000.model.users.User

  • public class User
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a user. Users have a unique ID which is generated randomly and stays with them throughout runs of the programme. It will be written to disk. There is a possibility to add a stopword: this also requires a minimum score at which it can be applied.
    Author:
    Kristof Buts

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      User(java.lang.String name)
      Use this when creating a *new* user that hasn't got an ID yet.
      User(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String name)
      Use this when importing a user that already has an ID.

      • User

        public User(java.lang.String id,
            java.lang.String name)
        Use this when importing a user that already has an ID. The user's lists are also read from disk automatically.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the user to be created, imported
        name - username

      • enableStopword

        public void enableStopword(java.lang.String stopword,
                           int minimumRequiredScoreToStop)
        Method to enable a stopword. A minimum score to be reached before it can be used must also be set.
        Parameters:
        stopword - Stopword to be used
        minimumRequiredScoreToStop - Minimum required score to be able to use the stopword
